meanings.definition: To offer a higher bid than someone else in an auction.
meanings.sent1: She outbidden all the other bidders for the antique vase.
meanings.sent2: The auction winner outbidden everyone with a last-minute bid.
meanings.sent3: The outbidden bidder playfully stuck out their tongue in mock defeat.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outbidden others was like a fierce lion in the bidding war.
meanings.sent5: The sound of her outbidden offer echoed through the auction hall.

meanings.sent1: He outbidden his rival by just a few dollars.
meanings.sent2: The company outbidden its competitors to secure the contract.
meanings.sent3: The outbidden team graciously congratulated the winners.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to outbidden others was like a shining star in the auction world.
meanings.sent5: The excitement in the room grew as she outbidden the previous highest bid.

meanings.sent1: Their offer outbidden the estimated value of the artwork.
meanings.sent2: The outbidden amount surprised even the auctioneer.
meanings.sent3: The outbidden bid made everyone gasp in disbelief.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outbidden others was like a powerful wave in the auction.
meanings.sent5: The outbidden bid broke all previous records for that item.
